name: Hitchhiker's Guide
story: The player is Arthur Dent, an ordinary Englishman whose life is about to be turned upside down. The player's house is about to be demolished, and Earth is about to be destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass. Adventure and absurdity await as the player tries to survive the destruction of Earth and navigate the galaxy.

Ford Prefect.name: Ford Prefect
Ford Prefect.description: Your friend who claims to be from Guildford but is actually a researcher for the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. He knows Earth is about to be destroyed.
items: Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy electronic book

earth_doom.story: The player's house is about to be demolished by bulldozers. The player must find Ford Prefect, who has a plan to save them both. The player has no idea that Earth is about to be destroyed.

Arthur's House.name: Arthur's House
Arthur's House.description: A typical English suburban home, complete with slippers and tea. Bulldozers are gathered outside.

Front Yard.name: Front Yard
Front Yard.description: The small patch of grass in front of Arthur's house, now surrounded by bulldozers and construction workers.

Kitchen.name: Kitchen
Kitchen.description: A cozy kitchen with tea-making equipment. Ford Prefect is here, acting strangely.

Road.name: Road
Road.description: The street outside Arthur's house, crowded with construction vehicles and workers.

Sidewalk.name: Sidewalk
Sidewalk.description: The sidewalk along the road, where Ford Prefect is trying to get Arthur's attention.

Mr. Prosser.name: Mr. Prosser
Mr. Prosser.description: The man in charge of demolishing Arthur's house. He has a half-Earth, half-Vogon brain.

contingency_prompts: Lying down in front of the bulldozers is a bold move of English civil disobedience.
When the player first encounters Ford Prefect, he seems oddly unconcerned about the bulldozers.
Ford Prefect never leaves the house until the player speaks with him.
To escape the demolition, the player must follow Ford Prefect's lead.
Stress the importance of acquiring the bath towel in the kitchen.
contingency_rules: If the player stays in the house and the demolition begins, set `house_demolished` to true and the game ends poorly.
The scene changes to 'hitchhiking' when the player reaches the sidewalk with Ford, or if he has already done so.
If Ford hands the bath towel to the player, add it to the player's inventory.

hitchhiking.story: With Ford's help, the player has escaped the demolition of their house. Now they must hitchhike to avoid the imminent destruction of Earth. Ford has a plan involving a Vogon constructor ship.

Road.name: Road
Road.description: The street outside Arthur's demolished house, now with a large hole where the house once stood.

Sidewalk.name: Sidewalk
Sidewalk.description: The sidewalk along the road, where Ford is trying to get Arthur to understand the gravity of the situation.

Field.name: Field
Field.description: An open field where Ford claims they can hitch a better ride. Strange lights appear in the sky.

blocked_exits.sky: You can't just fly up to the spaceship.

Vogon Ship.name: Vogon Ship
Vogon Ship.description: The massive, ugly Vogon constructor ship that has just arrived. It's not a comfortable place.

Ford Prefect.name: Ford Prefect
Ford Prefect.description: Your friend who is now revealing he's not from Guildford. He's trying to get you to hitch a ride on the Vogon ship.
items: Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy electronic book

Vogon Guard.name: Vogon Guard
Vogon Guard.description: A large, unpleasant-looking alien who enforces Vogon regulations with grim determination.

contingency_prompts: Ford explains that Earth is about to be destroyed for a hyperspace bypass.
The Vogon ship appears just as Earth is about to be destroyed.
Hitchhiking in space requires the right thumb signal and a certain disregard for personal safety.
Ford may recommend lying in front of the bulldozer, while he finishes preparations.
Ford stresses the importance of keeping a towel handy.
contingency_rules: Only when the player boards the Vogon ship with Ford, set `in_vogon_ship` to true.
When Earth is destroyed (automatically after a few turns), set `earth_destroyed` to true.
When the player boards the Vogon ship with Ford, update `scene_name` to 'vogon_poetry'.
If the player has already boarded the ship with Ford, update `scene_name` to 'vogon_poetry'.
If earth_destroyed is true and the player is not on the Vogon ship, the game ends immediately.

vogon_poetry.story: The player has narrowly escaped Earth's destruction but now faces the horrors of Vogon poetry. They must survive the poetry reading and find a way to escape the Vogon ship.

Vogon Holding Cell.name: Vogon Holding Cell
Vogon Holding Cell.description: A cold, damp cell on the Vogon constructor ship. Not the most pleasant place to be.

Vogon Corridor.name: Vogon Corridor
Vogon Corridor.description: A long, metallic corridor on the Vogon ship. The air smells faintly of decay.

Poetry Chamber.name: Poetry Chamber
Poetry Chamber.description: A large chamber where Vogons gather to inflict their poetry on prisoners. The walls are covered in bad poetry.

Space.name: Space
Space.description: The infinite void of space. Somehow, you've been thrown out of the Vogon ship.

Heart of Gold.name: Heart of Gold
Heart of Gold.description: A miraculous ship powered by the Infinite Improbability Drive. You've somehow hitched a ride!

Bridge.name: Bridge
Bridge.description: The control center of the Heart of Gold. Zaphod Beeblebrox and Trillian are here.

Ford Prefect.name: Ford Prefect
Ford Prefect.description: Your friend who's been through this before. He's trying to keep you alive through the Vogon poetry.
items: Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy electronic book

Vogon Captain.name: Vogon Captain
Vogon Captain.description: The captain of the Vogon constructor ship, known for his terrible poetry and lack of empathy.

Zaphod Beeblebrox.name: Zaphod Beeblebrox
Zaphod Beeblebrox.description: The ex-president of the galaxy and captain of the Heart of Gold. He's here to rescue you.

Trillian.name: Trillian
Trillian.description: The only other human in the galaxy, and a brilliant scientist. She's on the Heart of Gold.

contingency_prompts: Vogon poetry is so bad it can kill. The player must find a way to survive it.
The only known defense against Vogon poetry is having no imagination or being dead.
Ford suggests using a towel as a psychological weapon against Vogon poetry.
contingency_rules: If the player survives the Vogon poetry reading, set `poetry_survived` to true.
When the player is thrown out of the Vogon ship and into space, set `escaped_vogons` to true.
Only when `escaped_vogons` is true and the player has reached the Heart of Gold, the game ends successfully.

opening_prompt:
You are Arthur Dent, an ordinary Englishman. 

You have just woken who wakes up in your comfortable bed in your comfortable house in the comfortable English countryside. Something feels... off. The sound of bulldozers rumbles outside. 

What will you do next?
contingency_prompts: Arthur is English above all else. Use British humor in responses.
Remember that the answer to life, the universe, and everything is 42.
contingency_rules: Never let Ford Prefect leave the player's side once they've met. He is always ready to assist and will follow the player wherever they go.
